711190f-a.text:
317-334 West 13th Street, north side, between Eighth Avenue and Hudson Street, at the northern end of West 4th street. St Bernard's parochial school is the building at the left, with the flags
March 19, 1929
PL Sperr

710066f-b.text:
8th Avenue, north from W. 13th Street, showing the new County Trust Company Building at the N. E. corner of W. 14th Street. At the right is Greenwich Avenue and its cleared corner. Buildings here were demolished for a work shaft to the subway construction underground. Later this will be leased for a parking lot. A white ventilator building will be erected at the extreme right of same. This structure is not shown in View 2. The 2-story taxpa er? on the
8th Avenue side has just been completed.
In the background appears the New York Telephone Buildingg on W 17th Street and the Empire State Building (under construction in
view 1).
October 13, 1930
July 30, 1932
P. L. Sperr

710065f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, from W. 13th (right) to Horatio Streets as viewed westward from Jackson Square, showing the base of a triangular block that has W. 4th Street on its undisclosed side. View 2 is an oblique view southward from W. 13th Street. No. 3 is detailed to show the new gas station at the S. W. corner of W. 13th Street. This replaced the structure there as shown in the earlier view. Buildings on the right face on the south side of W. 13th Street and extend from 8th Avenue to W. 4th Street.
View 1: February 14, 1932
View 2: June 24, 1933
View 3: April 9, 1940
P. L. Sperr

710068f-a.text:
(1)
Eighth Ave., east side, north from Horatio to 13th Streets. The view also shows at the right Nos. 253-243 West 13th Street at the intersection of Horatio and 13th Streets, east of Jackson Square. Construction work is going on in Jackson Square in the foreground.
May 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a year later, showing Jackson Square cleared, preparatory,to making it into a miniature park.
July 30, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

720160f-a.text:
Greenwich Avenue from 13th Street to its north-western terminus at Eighth Avenue.
In background may be seen erection of the Port Authority Building.
May 15, 1932.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

710067f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, from W. 13th to 14th Streets as photograghed from atop the apartment house, No. 2 Horatio Street. At the right is 14th Street with its two bank buildings. Clearly shown is the former New York County National Bank at the S. E. corner. This institution was absorbed by the present Manufacturers Trust Company. Partially seen is the New York Savings Bank at the
N. W. corner.
View 2 is the same locale, minus the aforementioned corner
structures.
March 16, 1933
February 14, 1933
P. L. Sperr

710067f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, west side, from W. 13th to 14th Streets as photograghed from atop the apartment house, No. 2 Horatio Street. At the right is 14th Street with its two bank buildings. Clearly shown is the former New York County National Bank at the S. E. corner. This institution was absorbed by the present Manufacturers Trust Company. Partially seen is the New York Savings Bank at the
N. W. corner.
View 2 is the same locale, minus the aforementioned corner
structures.
March 16, 1933
February 14, 1933
P. L. Sperr

711188f-a.text:
(1) West 13th Street west from Eighth Avenue, showing on the left two additional streets; West 4th and Gansevoort Streets. The latter converges with 13th street and forms a triangle, the apex of which is a cleared space. Two 4 story structures stood their until recently (white painted walls) the 7 -story Trio building No. 652-664 Hudson Street Remains
April 17 1937
P. L. Sperr

(2) Slightly northward and eliminating West 4th Street. This photo shows a closer perspective of the triangular plot mentioned. Gansevoort Street is at the left.
April 17, 1937
P.L. Sperr

(3) Similar to No. 2 from a slightly different angle, and showing No. 327-335, St Bernard's Parochial School
April 17, 1937
P.L. Sperr

711186f-a.text:
301 to 331 West 13th Street, at, adjoining and west of the NW corner of Eighth Avenue. The loft structure housing the publishing departments of the Salvation Army is No. 321-23. Between this and St. Bernard's School is a 4 story residential building.
June 15, 1938
P.L. Sperr
